intro: Tetrastigma tetragynum, commonly known as the four-leaf grapevine, is a climbing vine native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Vitaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves, which often have four leaflets. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that give way to berries, which are typically yellow or red when mature. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in botany and horticulture.
